metadata.title: CVE-2019-11724 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Application permissions give additional remote troubleshooting permissionto the site input.mozilla.org, which has been retired and now redirects toanother site. This additional permission is unnecessary and is a potentialvector for malicious attacks. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 68.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-11724` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 68.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 68.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 68.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 68.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '68.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
